sections.title: Top Portable Career Sectors
sections.summary: Discover in-demand remote and portable career fields perfect for military life, including IT, healthcare, business, creative, and education sectors.
keyPoints: Tech & IT: Remote work in cybersecurity, web development, data analysis
Healthcare: Medical billing, telehealth, health information tech
Business: Project management, virtual assistance, bookkeeping
Creative: Graphic design, copywriting, social media management
Education: Online tutoring, instructional design, curriculum development

sections.title: MyCAA Scholarship - Up to $4,000
sections.summary: Military spouses of E1-E6, W1-W2, and O1-O3 can receive up to $4,000 for portable career training and certifications.
keyPoints: Eligibility: Spouses of E1-E6, W1-W2, O1-O3 on Title 10 orders
Funding: Up to $4,000 for associate degrees, licenses, or certifications
Process: Create account → Career plan → School approval → Direct payment
Timeline: Must complete program while spouse is on eligible orders

sections.title: Military Spouse Resume Tips
sections.summary: Translate your unique military life experience into a powerful resume that highlights transferable skills.
keyPoints: Highlight adaptability, leadership, and project management from PCS moves
Quantify achievements with specific numbers and outcomes
Use action verbs and focus on portable skills
Address gaps positively as periods of family focus or relocation

sections.title: High-Impact Career Certifications
sections.summary: Fast-track certifications (PMP, Salesforce Admin, Google Certificates) that boost income and are often MyCAA-funded.
keyPoints: PMP: Project Management Professional - globally recognized
Salesforce Admin: High demand for remote CRM management
Google Certificates: Data Analytics, UX Design, IT Support

sections.title: Complete PCS Checklist
sections.summary: Step-by-step checklist covering everything from orders receipt to final move-in at your new duty station.
keyPoints: 90 days out: Orders, housing research, school enrollment
60 days out: Household goods scheduling, travel arrangements
30 days out: Utilities, address changes, medical records
Move day: Inventory documentation, final inspections
Arrival: TLE/DLA claims, base orientation, new routine establishment

sections.title: PCS Budget & Financial Planning
sections.summary: Understand TLE, DLA, and travel reimbursements to avoid out-of-pocket costs during your move.
keyPoints: TLE: Temporary Lodging Expense for up to 10 days
DLA: Dislocation Allowance based on rank and dependents
MALT/POV: Mileage and per diem for drive moves
Advance pay: Request if needed for upfront costs

sections.title: Research Your New Base
sections.summary: Interactive guides for 25+ CONUS bases with maps, housing info, and insider tips from military families.
keyPoints: Housing options: On-base vs off-base neighborhoods
Schools: Ratings, waitlists, childcare availability
Community: Spouse clubs, family support, local activities
Employment: Job market, commute times, remote work options

sections.title: Maximize Commissary & Exchange Savings
sections.summary: Strategic shopping tips to save hundreds monthly using commissary sales and exchange benefits.
keyPoints: Commissary saves average family $4,500/year vs civilian stores
Shop sales: Case lot, holiday, and manager's specials
Exchange price matching and Star Card rewards
Combine with coupons and rewards programs

sections.title: Deployment Financial Preparation
sections.summary: Maximize SDP, adjust allotments, and prepare family finances for deployment period.
keyPoints: SDP: Earn 10% on up to $10,000 during deployment
Set up automatic bill payments and allotments
Emergency fund: Ensure spouse has access to 6 months expenses
Power of attorney: Financial and medical decisions

sections.title: Financial Reintegration
sections.summary: Smart strategies for managing SDP payout and readjusting to dual household finances.
keyPoints: SDP windfall: Invest strategically vs lifestyle inflation
Budget adjustment: Return to two-person household expenses
Debt payoff: Use lump sum wisely
Future planning: Next deployment or separation preparation
